definition: Tang Yulin (1871-1937), minor warlord in northeast China, sometime governor of Chengde 承德, mostly poor in battle but very successful at accumulating personal wealth
surname Tang
rushing current
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
jade
variant of 麟[lin2]
female unicorn/see 麒麟

sentences.english: Three years ago, Gao Jinghu offended Tang Yulin so there was no hospital in Jinghu.
sentences.chinese: 三年前高镜湖得罪了汤玉麟所以高镜湖没有医院可去。

definition: Zhang Zuolin (c. 1873-1928), warlord of Manchuria 1916-1928
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
Fengtian clique (of northern warlords)
Fengtian clique (of northern warlords)
Yan Xishan (1883-1960), warlord in Shanxi

Cao Kun (1862-1938), one of the Northern Warlords
Duan Qirui (1864-1936), commander of Beiyang Army under Yuan Shikai, then politician and powerful warlord
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
Zhao Erxun (1844-1927), modern historian, compiled the Draft History of the Qing dynasty 清史稿
Fu Zuoyi (1895-1974), Guomindang general, subsequently PRC top general and politician
north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
the Zhili faction of the Northern Warlords
Xu Shichang (1855-1939), politician associated with the Northern Warlords, president of China in 1921
Zhang Xun (1854-1923), Qing loyalist general who attempted to restore the abdicated emperor Puyi 溥儀|溥仪[Pu3 yi2] to the throne in the Manchu Restoration of 1917 張勳復辟|张勋复辟[Zhanɡ1 Xun1 Fu4 bi4]
Ni Sichong (1868-1924), general closely linked to Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 during his unsuccessful 1915 bid for Empire
